title: Man's Hat, 18th century
medium:
Medium: wool embroidery on linen and cotton ground, silk binding, silk and metallic thread tassel
Technique: embroidered using chain, buttonhole and stem stitches on plain weave
dimensions: H x W x D: 22.9 cm (9 in.)
creditline: Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline E. Greenleaf
description: Cap made of panels of undyed ribbed cotton with fairly deep cuff around brim, piped along four seams and along cuff-top with blue silk cloth; topped with silk and metal tassel.  Embroidered with bright crewels in chain stitch with symmetrical flower spray in each panel, floral scroll along cuff.  Unlined.

tombstone.epitaph:
Man's Hat, 18th century.
18th century. Medium: wool embroidery on linen and cotton ground, silk binding, silk and metallic thread tassel
Technique: embroidered using chain, buttonhole and stem stitches on plain weave. Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline E. Greenleaf. 1952-47-3.
